summary: This is an internal email update regarding the Maxwell/Epstein case. It mentions the expected completion of a Maxwell memo, the incorporation of a 'Farmer interview', and that the Epstein estate is taking steps to sell assets to meet a tax deadline, with the trustees' counsel offering to discuss maintaining the government's forfeiture interest.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The primary subject of a legal memo being prepared by the team, likely Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier, subject of estate matters
persons.context: Referred to in the context of his estate's financial dealings, including selling properties to meet tax obligations.

persons.name: Farmer
persons.context: An individual who was interviewed by the legal team; the interview was incorporated into the Maxwell memo.

connections.description: The document contextually links Maxwell and Epstein as subjects of the same legal case and financial estate matters.

events.title: Email Update on Maxwell Memo and Estate
events.description: An internal email provides an update on the preparation of a Maxwell legal memo and conveys information from the Epstein estate trustees about asset sales.

events.title: Epstein Estate Tax Deadline
events.description: The estate of Jeffrey Epstein has a deadline to pay taxes, prompting the sale of illiquid assets including New York and other properties.

keyFacts: A legal memo concerning Ghislaine Maxwell was expected to be completed by the end of the week of May 19, 2020.
The legal team had recently conducted an interview with an individual named 'Farmer', which was incorporated into the Maxwell memo.
The trustees of Jeffrey Epstein's estate contacted the legal team, stating the estate must sell assets (including NY properties) to meet a July 15, 2020 tax deadline.
The Epstein estate attempted to get the IRS to delay tax enforcement but was refused.
The estate's attorneys indicated a willingness to discuss preserving the government's forfeiture interest in relevant assets, but the team did not engage per prior directions.
